story.name: ANDYSMANCLUB x Britvic – Nutrition Expert Jenny Hardwick on Hydration & Mental Health!
story.content: {"_uid":"42663d39-8b76-4c31-8b4d-c0dbd23621d0","body":[{"_uid":"31441e4e-18eb-494c-9014-68cd1e558934","title":"","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"After announcing our partnership earlier this week, we spoke to Jenny Hardwick, a member of Britvic’s Nutrition Team, about the links between hydration, nutrition and positive Mental Health.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Good Hydration for a Good Mood","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"There are increasing amounts of scientific evidence to suggest that what we put into our bodies has a real influence on our mood. A healthy and balanced diet plays a role in regulating our mood as does good hydration, so it’s not to be forgotten about! The human body is made up of around 70% water and it plays several roles from helping to keep your heart pumping to regulating body temperature, so it’s important that we keep topped up, aiming for 1.5-2L water per day.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"What are the effects of dehydration on our wellbeing?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"When we’re dehydrated, it can take its toll on our mental wellbeing. Feelings of tiredness, dizziness and light-headedness are common, and it can impact our emotional state making us more irritable.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Concentration and memory can also be impaired and together these symptoms could leave us feeling in a poor state of wellbeing. Studies suggest that even mild dehydration can lead to increased tension and anxiety.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How do you know if you’re dehydrated?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Do you feel thirsty? That’s our bodies way of telling us we need to drink more! Also, check your pee, if you’re dehydrated your pee will be a dark yellow or orange colour so you need to be drinking more.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Good sources of hydration","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Water is the gold standard for hydration. Free of calories and straight out of the tap.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Tea/ coffee/ herbal tea provide hydration and some extra nutrition if you add milk. Don’t forget to be mindful of the amount of caffeine you’re having with tea/coffee.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Milk counts as fluid and is a great way to get extra calcium in your diet. Be mindful of the fat content and choose semi-skimmed or skimmed if you’re managing your weight and full fat if you’re looking to gain weight.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Sugar free soft drinks such as squash and sodas make hydration a little more interesting. Add a drop of squash to still or sparkling water to make yourself a refreshing drink. These drinks are acidic so drink in moderation.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Fruit and Vegetables also contribute to your fluid intake! Cucumber, tomatoes, mushrooms, watermelon and apples are just a few of the foods which are high in water. It’s also a great way of reaching your 5-a day. Don’t forget smoothies and juices count too but stick to a 150ml portion per day.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Keep a water bottle handy wherever you are, if it’s there you’ll drink it! Aim for 1.5 – 2 litres a day.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Eat your fruit and veg, not only is this great for overall health and wellbeing but it also helps you to keep hydrated.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Not a fan of water? Add sugar-free squash or a wedge of fruit to make it more interesting!","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Drink more if it’s hot or if you’ve been particularly active.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"blok","attrs":{"id":"a2786c24-b355-4d44-8013-59812f56c317","body":[{"_uid":"i-b6316be5-4151-4edd-a28f-cabec58ab6ba","title":"Resources / References","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Feeding Minds, Mental Health Foundation –","type":"text"},{"type":"hard_break"},{"text":"https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/sites/default/files/Feeding-Minds.pdf","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/sites/default/files/Feeding-Minds.pdf","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"British Dietetic Association & Mind ","type":"text"},{"type":"hard_break"},{"text":"https://www.mindcharity.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/foodmood.pdf","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.mindcharity.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/foodmood.pdf","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"British Nutrition Foundation – Healthy Hydration","type":"text"},{"type":"hard_break"},{"text":"https://www.nutrition.org.uk/attachments/article/429/Healthy%20hydration%20for%20adults.pdf","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.nutrition.org.uk/attachments/article/429/Healthy%20hydration%20for%20adults.pdf","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Adan, A. 2012. Cognitive Performance and Dehydration.
